customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: it works great. The only reason that it is not getting 5 stars is that it has a hair trigger that likes to spit out 2 or 3 nails at a time when used with the trigger continuously held in. I have been in construction for 25 years and used to swear by Dewalt. I am now slowly moving toward Milwaukee because of the warranty policy. However they still make a great product 95% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Barker

customer_reviews.title: Great Nailer
customer_reviews.text: The last time I did a roof was for a 10x14 shed. I did that with a hammer. Never again. Especially now. This nail gun worked great!! I did a complete tear off of a 15x24 hip roof. This roofing nailer helped me to get the entire roof done in a day by myself. It was easy to load and use. The trigger is very sensitive and double fired a couple of times. It jammed once but was very easy to get the gun unjammed. I think this is going to be VERY helpful when I put an extension on the garage and build my workshop.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: which is pretty thick and sturdy as well
customer_reviews.text: These things are built solid as a rock, the only plastic part is the coil cover, which is pretty thick and sturdy as well. Loading the coil is simple and quick, the quick depth setting knob is very useful when switching from shingle to flashing and back. It does tend to double tap easily, but the 2nd tap does not advance a nail which is nice. The last nail in the coil is always discarded and it didn't come with a belt/rafter hook which is why I took off one star. Otherwise this is a rock solid gun.
customer_reviews.author: Shea Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Not up to DeWALT’s standards
customer_reviews.text: This gun has been a disappointment. I like DeWALT tools and own quite a few because of their consistent quality. This gun doesn’t live up to the other tools. So far, I’ve tried both 1 1/4” nails and 1 3/4” nails. Both have experienced frequent jams (1 in 10 nails), failure to auto feed the nails, and random multiple nails being fired (I’ll get between zero and three nails being fired with each trigger pull).

product_meta.title: DEWALT DW45RN Pneumatic Coil Roofing Nailer
product_meta.description: High speed valve technology drives over 10 nails per second. High lifetime engine seals and feed system for durability and long life. Depth adjust wheel with numbered detents helps drive nails to the proper depth into a variety of materials. Ergonomic design is lighter (4.5 lbs.) than leading competitive Coil roofing mailers. Steel skid plates with rubber inserts protect the tool and help to stop it from sliding. Operating pressure: 70-120 PSI. Over mold grip. Fixed exhaust.
